TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DateFormat extends Java.Text._Format

Docs.summary: DateFormat is an abstract class for date/time formatting subclasses which formats and parses dates or time in a language-independent manner.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string Format(class Java.Util.Date date) cil managed

Docs.param: the time value to be formatted into a time string.
Docs.summary: Formats a Date into a date/time string.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public override sealed Java.Lang.StringBuffer Format (Java.Lang.Object obj, Java.Lang.StringBuffer toAppendTo, Java.Text.FieldPosition fieldPosition);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Lang.StringBuffer Format(class Java.Lang.Object obj, class Java.Lang.StringBuffer toAppendTo, class Java.Text.FieldPosition fieldPosition) cil managed
override this.Format : Java.Lang.Object * Java.Lang.StringBuffer * Java.Text.FieldPosition -> Java.Lang.StringBuffer

Docs.param: must be a Number or a Date.
the string buffer for the returning time string.

keeps track of the position of the field within the returned string. On input: an alignment field, if desired. On output: the offsets of the alignment field. For example, given a time text "1996.07.10 AD at 15:08:56 PDT", if the given fieldPosition is DateFormat.YEAR_FIELD, the begin index and end index of fieldPosition will be set to 0 and 4, respectively. Notice that if the same time field appears more than once in a pattern, the fieldPosition will be set for the first occurrence of that time field. For instance, formatting a Date to the time string "1 PM PDT (Pacific Daylight Time)" using the pattern "h a z (zzzz)" and the alignment field DateFormat.TIMEZONE_FIELD, the begin index and end index of fieldPosition will be set to 5 and 8, respectively, for the first occurrence of the timezone pattern character 'z'.
Docs.summary: Overrides Format.
Docs.returns: the string buffer passed in as toAppendTo, with formatted text appended.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if object is neither a Date nor a Number instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Java.Lang.StringBuffer Format (Java.Util.Date date, Java.Lang.StringBuffer toAppendTo, Java.Text.FieldPosition fieldPosition);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.StringBuffer Format(class Java.Util.Date date, class Java.Lang.StringBuffer toAppendTo, class Java.Text.FieldPosition fieldPosition) cil managed
override this.Format : Java.Util.Date * Java.Lang.StringBuffer * Java.Text.FieldPosition -> Java.Lang.StringBuffer

Docs.param: a Date to be formatted into a date/time string.
the string buffer for the returning date/time string.

keeps track of the position of the field within the returned string. On input: an alignment field, if desired. On output: the offsets of the alignment field. For example, given a time text "1996.07.10 AD at 15:08:56 PDT", if the given fieldPosition is DateFormat.YEAR_FIELD, the begin index and end index of fieldPosition will be set to 0 and 4, respectively. Notice that if the same time field appears more than once in a pattern, the fieldPosition will be set for the first occurrence of that time field. For instance, formatting a Date to the time string "1 PM PDT (Pacific Daylight Time)" using the pattern "h a z (zzzz)" and the alignment field DateFormat.TIMEZONE_FIELD, the begin index and end index of fieldPosition will be set to 5 and 8, respectively, for the first occurrence of the timezone pattern character 'z'.
Docs.summary: Formats a Date into a date/time string.
Docs.returns: the string buffer passed in as toAppendTo, with formatted text appended.

Docs.param: The date/time string to be parsed

Docs.returns: A Date, or null if the input could not be parsed
